unnormalised: Okay, so my friend Rahul was sweating bullets over his Linear Algebra exam. He called me at 11 PM freaking out about finding the inverse of a 3x3 matrix. Apparently, his Prof. Sharma gave them this beast of a problem with entries like sqrt(2) and pi/4! I told him, "Bhai, just chill! It's not like you're calculating the trajectory for Chandrayaan-4 or something. Just apply Gauss-Jordan elimination...or better yet, bribe someone who knows their stuff!" He wasn't amused. Hope he passed. Else heâ€™ll have to prepone his Goa plans.
normalised: Okay, so my friend Rahul was sweating bullets over his Linear Algebra exam. He called me at eleven P.M. freaking out about finding the inverse of a three by three matrix. Apparently, his Professor Sharma gave them this beast of a problem with entries like square root of two and pi divided by four! I told him, "Bhai, just chill! It's not like you're calculating the trajectory for Chandrayaan-four or something. Just apply Gauss-Jordan elimination...or better yet, bribe someone who knows their stuff!" He wasn't amused. Hope he passed. Else he'll have to prepone his Goa plans.
